IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: HUNTINGTON UNIVERSITY IS A CHRIST- CENTERED INSTITUTION THAT EXISTS TO CARRY OUT THE MISSION OF CHRIST IN HIGHER EDUCATION THROUGH A CURRICULUM OF ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: HUNTINGTON UNIVERSITY IS A CHRIST-CENTERED LIBERAL ARTS INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION WITH A STRONG HISTORIC AND ONGOING RELATIONSHIP WITH THE CHURCH OF THE UNITED BRETHREN IN CHRIST, USA. WITH THE CONVICTION THAT ALL TRUTH IS GOD'S TRUTH, THE UNIVERSITY EXISTS TO CARRY OUT THE MISSION OF CHRIST IN HIGHER EDUCATION. THROUGH A CURRICULUM OF DEMONSTRATED ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, STUDENTS ARE EDUCATED IN THE LIBERAL ARTS AND THEIR CHOSEN DISCIPLINES, ALWAYS SEEKING TO EXAMINE THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE DISCIPLINES AND GOD'S REVELATION IN JESUS CHRIST.
IRS990.Desc: HUNTINGTON UNIVERSITY IS A CHRISTIAN UNIVERSITY WITH THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF EDUCATING AND DEVELOPING INDIVIDUALS. THE UNIVERSITY CURRENTLY CONSISTS OF 1,300 STUDENTS AND OFFERS MORE THAN 70 UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE DEGREE PROGRAMS. AS A CHRISTIAN UNIVERSITY, HUNTINGTON IS COMMITTED TO DEVELOPING THE WHOLE PERSON, ASSISTING STUDENTS WITH UNDERSTANDING ALL AREAS OF HUMAN KNOWLEDGE FROM THE PERSPECTIVE OF A CHRISTIAN WORLDVIEW, AND PREPARING THEM TO IMPACT THEIR WORLD FOR CHRIST.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: VP FOR ACADEMIC AFFAIRS AND DE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IT IS THE POLICY OF THE UNIVERSITY NOT TO RECOGNIZE CONTRIBUTIONS OF WORKS OF ART BECAUSE THE ITEMS ARE HELD FOR PUBLIC EXHIBITION RATHER THAN FINANCIAL GAIN.
THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVED A DONATION OF VARIOUS WORKS OF ART IN 1987. THE COLLECTION INCLUDES 107 ITEMS AND IS DISPLAYED IN SEVERAL LOCATIONS ON CAMPUS INCLUDING THE WILSON ART GALLERY.
THE UNIVERSITY'S ENDOWMENT FUND IS DESIGNATED TO PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER FUNDS TO SUPPORT OPERATIONS OF THE INSTITUTION.
STUDENT FINANCIAL AID $10,857,145 CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS $ 93,791 TOTAL $10,950,936 SCHEDULE D, PART XII LINE 4B STUDENT FINANCIAL AID $10,857,145

MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THEIR INCOME TAX POSITIONS UNDER THE GUIDANCE INCLUDED IN ASC 740. BASED ON THEIR REVIEW, MANAGEMENT HAS NOT IDENTIFIED ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TO BE RECORDED OR DISCLOSED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

NEWSPAPERS, CATALOGS, INTERNET WEB PAGE, AND ADVERTISING MEDIA CONTAIN HUNTINGTON UNIVERSITY'S RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY EITHER PUBLISHED OR BROADCASTED FOR STUDENT RECRUITMENT, REGISTRATION OR RETENTION AND PERSONNEL RECRUITMENT.
HUNTINGTON UNIVERSITY RECEIVES FINANCIAL AID FROM A GOVERNMENTAL AGENCY IN THE FORM OF GRANTS AND LOANS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: AFTER STUDENT HAS BEEN ACCEPTED, THEY MUST FILE A FAFSA. THE UNIVERSITY CONSIDERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS, OUTSIDE SCHOLARSHIPS, FEDERAL GRANTS AND STATE ELIGIBILITY IN THAT RESPECTIVE ORDER. IF THE STUDENT NEEDS FURTHER ASSISTANCE, THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS FEDERAL LOANS, COLLEGE GRANTS AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID BASED ON NEED IS AWARDED ON FAFSA CALCULATIONS AND THE RESULTING FINANCIAL AID THAT IS TO BE MET. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GPA, CLASS RANK AND STANDARD TEST SCORES. NEED-BASED GRANTS CAN BE ALLOCATED TO RETURNING STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS YEARS AS LONG AS FINANCIAL NEED IS STILL PRESENT. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS CONTINUE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GPA AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

THE UNIVERSITY PRESIDENT RESIDES IN A UNIVERSITY OWNED HOUSE. THE HOUSE IS USED FOR UNIVERSITY FUNCTIONS INCLUDING RECEPTIONS, DINNERS AND OTHER BUSINESS EVENTS. THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF THE PRESIDENT'S HOUSING IS THEREFORE INCLUDED IN NONTAXABLE COMPENSATION.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CITY OF HUNTINGTON INDIANA ECONOMIC AUTHORITY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: QUALIFIED COMPANIES WERE HIRED TO SELL SECURITIES, LAND AND COMMODITIES. THE ARRANGEMENTS WERE IN THE NORMAL COURSE OF BUSINESS FOR THESE COMPANIES.

THOMAS A. CLOUNIE OWNS 100% OF CLOUNIE LANDSCAPING, AN INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR FOR THE UNIVERSITY. AS A RESULT, HE IS CONSIDERED A NON-INDEPENDENT BOARD MEMBER. FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B FORM 990, EXCLUDING SCHEDULE B, IS PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING. A COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE UNIVERSITY, THE GOVERNING BODY RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEW OF ALL FINANCIAL OPERATIONS OF THE UNIVERSITY, BEFORE THE 990 IS FILED. AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM ALSO PERFORMS A REVIEW OF FORM 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD DEVELOPMENT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE ANNUALLY CONFIRMS THE RECEIPT OF SIGNED CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS FROM ALL BOARD MEMBERS, OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES AND REVIEWS THE ANSWERS SUBMITTED FOR ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. THAT TRUSTEE, OFFICER, OR KEY EMPLOYEE WHO HAS DISCLOSED AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, OR WHO HAS BEEN FOUND TO HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WILL NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE UNIVERSITY'S DECISION MAKING PROCESS WITH REGARD TO THAT TRANSACTION, EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT EXPRESSLY REQUESTED IN WRITING BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OR ITS BOARD DEVELOPMENT COMMITTEE. SHOULD A CONFLICT OF INTEREST MATTER REQUIRE A VOTE BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OR ONE OF ITS COMMITTEES, THAT TRUSTEE OR OFFICER SHALL NOT BE PRESENT AT THE TIME OF THE VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE BOARD COMPARES THE DATA TO COMPARATIVE INSTITUTIONS. A REVIEW WAS COMPLETED IN FISCAL YEAR 2017-18.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT REVIEWS COMPARATIVE SALARY INFORMATION FOR ALL OFFICER POSITIONS AND SETS SALARIES FOR THEM ANNUALLY AND INFORMS THE BOARD CHAIR OF HIS/HER ACTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE PROVIDED TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
